title: Positioning Framework
summary: Eight framing questions and a worksheet to sharpen audience, category, differentiation, and proof.

sections.title: Before rewriting copy
sections.body: Answer these prompts first, then convert answers into homepage language and sales proof.

items.title: What do we stand for?
items.whyItMatters: Purpose and principles keep positioning consistent across pages and conversations.
items.outputFormat: One purpose line and three operating principles.
items.example: We help operators regain control of execution decisions.

items.title: What value do clients feel first?
items.whyItMatters: Early value decides whether buyers keep listening.
items.outputFormat: Top three outcomes with simple measures.
items.example: Fewer handoffs, faster approvals, lower software overhead.

items.title: What alternatives exist today?
items.whyItMatters: Buyers compare you to current habits, not just direct competitors.
items.outputFormat: List current options and their tradeoffs.
items.example: Status quo, internal stopgaps, broad advisory retainers.

items.title: How are we meaningfully different?
items.whyItMatters: Differentiation must tie directly to business impact.
items.outputFormat: Three differentiators and the business outcome for each.

items.title: Who needs this most right now?
items.whyItMatters: Focus improves clarity, conversion, and case-study relevance.
items.outputFormat: Ideal customer profile by size, role, and trigger.
items.example: COOs managing fragmented workflows across multiple systems.

items.title: What category are we in?
items.whyItMatters: Category language helps buyers understand where you fit.
items.outputFormat: One category label plus a plain-language definition.
items.example: Execution consultancy: strategy and operating build in one motion.

items.title: What happens if they wait?
items.whyItMatters: Inaction costs create urgency without fear-based messaging.
items.outputFormat: Five concrete consequences stated in business terms.
items.example: Decision latency rises while software spend remains fixed.

items.title: Can we summarize it in two sentences?
items.whyItMatters: If the message cannot be short, it will not travel.
items.outputFormat: Two-sentence positioning statement and one short headline.
items.example: For operations leaders, we build execution systems that simplify delivery and governance.

sections.title: Your 2-Sentence Positioning Statement
sections.template: For [target], who [need], we provide [category] that delivers [outcome], because [differentiator].

sections.title: Consequences of Inaction
items: Cost drift continues while capability gains flatten.
Critical logic remains scattered and hard to govern.
Teams keep spending time on reconciliation work.
Operational knowledge stays trapped in individuals.
Change requests keep competing with platform constraints.

cards.title: Refining Target Focus
whatToDo: Narrow to one high-fit decision maker profile.
Map top trigger events for that audience.
Align page messaging to one primary pain pattern.
goodLooksLike: Sales calls start with fewer qualification loops.
cards.deliverable: Ideal-customer profile brief with trigger matrix

cards.title: Strengthening Differentiators
whatToDo: Audit competitor claims for repeated language.
Tie each differentiator to one measurable outcome.
Replace generic claims with specific operating methods.
goodLooksLike: Prospects repeat your language back in discovery.
Pricing conversations center on value, not hours.

cards.title: Category Creation & Education
whatToDo: Define category terms in one simple framework.
Publish a short explainer and visual model.
Use repeated language across web, decks, and calls.
goodLooksLike: Buyers adopt your category wording consistently.
Inbound questions shift from what to why-now.

cards.title: Addressing Client Concerns
whatToDo: List top objections from recent calls.
Create evidence-backed responses for each objection.
Embed responses into page copy and FAQs.
goodLooksLike: Fewer late-stage security and ownership concerns.
Shorter path from first call to pilot decision.
cards.deliverable: Objection handling guide with proof links

cards.title: Testing & Iteration
whatToDo: Test two headline variants per major page.
Track message resonance in discovery notes.
Retire phrases that do not improve conversion.
goodLooksLike: Higher conversion from research pages to contact.
Internal teams use the same message consistently.
